discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To provide Enterprise Voice to the users in Site1 by configuring SBC2 to use SBC1, you should configure a proxy SBC (Option B). This setup allows SBC2 to route calls through SBC1, leveraging the existing Direct Routing configuration and MPLS connection.

Selected Answer: B
B: Proxy SBC is a configuration where SBC2 at Site1 will route its calls to SBC1, which is located in the datacenter. SBC1 serves as the proxy SBC and forwards the traffic between SBC2 and Microsoft Teams (via Direct Routing).

questions.question_text:
You have a Teams Phone deployment.

You have a site named Site1 that contains a Session Border Controller (SBC) named SBC2. SBC2 uses Direct Routing and does NOT have local internet connectivity.

Site1 has an MPLS connection to a datacenter that hosts another SBC named SBC1. SBC1 uses Direct Routing.

You need to provide Enterprise Voice to the users in Site1 by configuring SBC2 to use SBC1.

What should you configure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Its E

Explanation:
To adjust the video size in the Front Row meeting layout for Microsoft Teams Rooms (MTR), you need to modify the layout settings using an XML configuration file.

Microsoft Teams Rooms supports custom configuration through an XML file called SkypeSettings.xml.
This file allows you to modify the front row layout, adjust video scaling, and configure other room settings.

questions.question_text:
You deploy Microsoft Teams Rooms.

During a meeting, participants report that when they set the front row meeting layout, the video size is too small.

You need to increase the video size of the front row meeting layout.

What should you use?

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to provide users with the ability to update their emergency address when working from home.

What should you configure in the Microsoft Teams admin center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Its A

Why A (Roaming Policy) Is Correct?
A Roaming Policy (Emergency Location Policy) ensures that:
✔️ Users can update their emergency address when working from home
✔️ Teams prompts users to enter their location when connecting from a new network
✔️ The correct address is used for E911 calls

Without a Roaming Policy, emergency calls from remote workers could be sent to the wrong Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP).
I think first answer is N, becuase custom theme is not enabled. Theme is default. So N,Y,N.

comments.content: Sorry, YYN because for custom background you need a pro license
Room 3 only has a basic license

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Options A, B, and D are related to call quality and endpoint reports but may not provide specific information about SIP errors on the SBC.
C should be correct. Just check Teams Admin Center -> Voice -> Direct Routing -> select an SBC -> Usage -> go to the bottom of the page -> First column called SIP Response Codes.

Selected Answer: C
it talks about quanity..
Network Effectiveness Ratio (NER) - The NER measures the ability of a network to deliver calls by measuring the number of calls sent versus the number of calls delivered to a recipient.

In some cases, especially during the initial pairing, there might be issues related to misconfiguration of the SBCs or the Direct Routing service.

You can use the following tools to monitor your configuration:

Call Quality Dashboard
SBC logs
The Direct Routing service has descriptive error codes reported to either Call Analytics or the SBC logs.

Seems like A is the correct response from reading here:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/cqd-data-and-reports#detailed-reports
Also, C doesn't mention the Health Dashboard, it talks about the Usage tab, which is not where the Health Dashboard for Direct Routing can be found.

Selected Answer: C
Health Dashboard for Direct Routing lets you monitor the connection between your Session Border Controller (SBC) and the Direct Routing interface. With Health Dashboard, you can monitor information about your SBC, This information can help you identify issues, including the reason for dropped calls. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-health-dashboard
for me is the option C from TAC

questions.question_text:
You have a Teams Phone deployment. The deployment has a single Session Border Controller (SBC) that uses Direct Routing.
Users report that outbound PSTN calls fail.
You need to identify the quantity of specific SBC SIP errors.
What should you review?

choices.C: the network effectiveness ratio on the Usage tab for the SBC in the Microsoft Teams admin center
choices.D: Endpoint Reports in Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard
choices.A: Quality of Experience Reports in Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard
choices.B: the Jitter tab in Network parameters in the Microsoft Teams admin center
